awd_titl_txt: Acquistion of Equipment for Polymer Synthesis Research
awd_abstract_narration: This instrumentation will be used to support the polymer                   synthesis effort in the Polymers Program at Penn State University.              The principal need is for GPC/light scattering equipment which                  allows a complete characterization of the molecular weight                      distribution of homopolymers and copolymers.  Furthermore, this                 instrumentation also provides fundamental information concerning                the molecular architecture of polymers.                                              It is proposed to use the instrumentation as a central                     facility for the department and several groups will utilize it in               their research.  Amongst the projects that will be supported by                 this equipment are;                                                             a)   The synthesis of novel polymer materials using boron chemistry             b)   the synthesis of cleavable linear, star, ring and cross-linked             homopolymers and copolymers using anionic chemistry                             c)   the synthesis of homopolymers and copolymers containing                    strongly interacting functional groups.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
